pr_title: HDDS-2956. Handle Replay of AllocateBlock request

timeline.message: HDDS-2956. Handle Replay of AllocateBlock request

timeline.bodyText:
I think, this check will help only when Key is created and Committed. But it will not help in the scenario:
T1 - Key Create
T2 - allocate block
T3 - Key Commit
T4- Key Delete
When replay, we will still throw an error, as it will not be in the openKeyTable. So, I think it is okay not to get from key table and do a check. As we cannot 100% find replay transactions.
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: My intention was to capture the maximum number of cases. If Key is deleted, we cannot help it. And this does not affect the regular case when the openKey exists. So it is not a performance concern.
replies.author: hanishakoneru

timeline.bodyText: Just one minor comment, can we eliminate renaming variable changes, as this is increasing jira scope and code line changes. As with focussed change, it will be simple.

replies.bodyText: Sure. I will avoid it in future. The variable names were so big that it was causing unnecessary increase in the lines of code. I was trying to club code cleanup along with these changes. But I will reserve it for separate Jira in the future.
